attributes.action: Baroness Warsi should apologise for calling secular people who disagree with her 'militant'
attributes.additional_details:
Baroness Warsi is quoted on the BBC stating that 'Britain is under threat from a rising tide of "militant secularisation"'
I feel that this vast mislabeling of people who do not wish to be part of a religious community should be apologised for.
If Baroness Warsi can quote any figure that shows secular people have, in the name of hating people who believe in something as opposed to nothing, performed even 0.1% of the number of violent acts (adjusted proportionally for the percentage of secular populatio) as religious people have made because people do not believe the same, then she may have a point. As she will be unable to make this claim, the term 'militant' is inappropriate and unwarrented.
